lead_paragraph: PLAYER Paolo Maldini, 39, who won his third FIFA Club World Cup with A.C. Milan on Sunday in a 4-2 victory against Boca Juniors in Japan, said he would retire at the end of the Italian season in June. Maldini, who has played for Milan since the 1984-85 season, has won many major titles with the club, including seven Serie A titles and five European Champions League titles.
